articles.title: Hubble Confirms Megacomet Bound for Inner Solar System Is Largest Ever Seen - Scientific American
articles.description: The icy nucleus stretches about 80 miles (129 kilometers) across.
articles.content: These images from the Hubble Space Telescope show the comet C/2014 UN271 (Bernardinelli-Berstein), the biggest comet ever seen, NASA says. (Image credit: NASA, ESA, Man-To Hui (Macau University of Sc… [+5315 chars]

articles.title: Moderate Geomagnetic Storm To Hit Earth Today, Says NASA - NDTV
articles.description: American space agency National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has said that a geomagnetic storm, triggered by a high-intensity Coronal Mass Ejection (CME) on the Sun, is expected to hit the Earth on Thursday.
articles.content:
A geomagnetic storm is expected to hit the Earth on Thursday.

source.name: American Council on Science and Health

articles.title: The Clinical Trial That Should (But Probably Won't) Close the Book on Ivermectin - American Council on Science and Health
articles.description: The controversy surrounding ivermectin as a therapy for COVID has been longstanding and fierce. A recent paper in NEJM may or may not settle the ongoing debate. But the paper is full of data. Here is a condensed look at the key numbers.
articles.content: About a week ago, news outlets reported that a large randomized controlled trial showed that ivermectin had no impact on COVID. At that time, only scant data on which the conclusions were based were … [+6315 chars]
